listing.listing_description: _ Please note that there is an ongoing construction project near this villa. For more information, please contact a Villa Specialist. _Stay amid the icons of London in your own private pied-à-terre at Mayfair One. Tucked behind the famed Claridge’s hotel and restaurant, this jewel-like vacation rental is an oasis within easy reach of everything from shops and eateries to palaces and museums. This one-bedroom luxury property is just the right size for a couple wanting a getaway or a honeymoon in the heart of the city.Mayfair One has all the comforts of home: a TV to entertain you after a day of sightseeing, heating and air conditioning for whatever the London weather does, laundry facilities to make it easy to get ready for another day out or a special evening, and Wi-Fi to keep you in touch with friends and family at home.Taking its inspiration from both mid-century and modern style, the apartment is a study in understated glamour. The neutral tones of its open-concept living and dining room are set off by accents in jewel-toned fabrics and metallic artwork, as well as a geometric-patterned area rug. The separate kitchen is fully equipped and features stylishly high-contrast white cabinets against dark countertops.The bedroom at Mayfair One has a king bed, TV and en-suite bathroom. Its chic silver-toned carpet matches the floor-length drapes, and a tufted headboard echoes the built-in storage. In the bathroom, polished stone tile lends spa-worthy appeal.As this is the middle of London, there’s something nearby to make everyone’s holiday. The villa is surrounded by shops where you’ll find everything from vintage to couture and restaurants where you can have a quick coffee or a dinner to remember. It’s less than a 15-minute walk to Hyde Park and Piccadilly Circus, and less than a 20-minute drive to Trafalgar Square, Kensington Palace and Buckingham Palace, plus Westminster Abbey and Big Ben.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Please note that this property is in close proximity to a construction project. For more information, please contact a Villa Specialist.Stay in a brand-new building in a neighborhood with character at Goodge Street. This modern vacation rental is in the heart of Fitzrovia, a central area of London that was once known for its boho past and today is a lively mix of cafés, offices and residential streets. Make this two-bedroom apartment your home for a getaway with friends, a holiday with family or a honeymoon in one of the world’s great cities.The villa’s state-of-the-art amenities range from a TV, DVD player, sound system and Wi-Fi to an espresso machine, heating, air conditioning and laundry facilities. In warmer weather, relax with a glass of wine on the apartment’s spacious private terrace; when it’s cold outside, cozy up indoors by the fireplace.A fold-away glass wall links the terrace with the open-concept living and dining room, flooding the interiors with sunlight and allowing you to create one large space during the summer. A sleek wall of built-in cabinets conceals the TV and fireplace, while pieces like brass-toned accent tables add a touch of glam. The galley kitchen is just through a doorway beyond the dining table and is fully equipped.Each of the two bedrooms at Goodge Street has a double bed; one has an en-suite bathroom and the other has access to a shared bathroom. Like the main living areas, the bedrooms are spacious and bright, and one even offers terrace access.From this luxury property’s location near the intersection of Goodge Street and Tottenham Court Road, it’s a 15-minute drive or less to attractions such as St. Paul’s Cathedral, Hyde Park, Kensington Palace, Trafalgar Square and Covent Garden. For shopping, dining and nightlife, you’ll find everything from chic bistros to old-fashioned pubs close at hand in Fitzrovia.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Villa dell'Angelo is a restored 18th-century Tuscan villa on the western slope of Mount Albano, with an expansive saline pool and antique-filled interior that make it the ideal accommodation for a family or group of up to eight people.Cradled among spectacular views of the mountains, Villa Angelo is an exceptional 4-bedroom stone villa that embodies genuine Tuscan flavor. Villa dell'Angelo presents a picturesque location for a family gathering or special occasion, and is outfitted with the modern comforts you require for a relaxing holiday.This villa is centered on 18 acres of woods and olive groves. The living areas have been decorated with antique furniture (some pieces dating back as far as the 16th century), paintings, doors, prints and Persian carpets for an authentic atmosphere. Sink into plush damask sofas in the living room, which is dominated by a large carved stone decorative fireplace, and topped by a coffered ceiling. The large antique dining table is the ideal place to gather for a special Italian meal with family or friends. Cozy up to the kitchen’s fireplace and savor a true-to-life, historic Italian kitchen that is nonetheless fully equipped.After a wonderful meal, drift off to sleep under the soaring ceilings of the bedrooms. The bathrooms are updated with modern conveniences, such as rainhead showers and jetted tubs. Outdoors, the lawn is kept manicured and several outdoor seating areas create inviting spaces to enjoy a glass of wine among the olive and cypress trees. The saline pool features a large hydromassage area, terrace and changing area.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: What lies beneath this 16th-century brick villa is a hidden indulgence: a private spa with a secret pool. There are more obvious charms, too: two wings overlooking the Tuscan countryside, a magazine-worthy mix of ancient architecture and up-to-the-minute furnishings, and a location in the heart of hilltop San Miniato. It’s a 5-minute walk to restaurants and shops beneath the town’s clock tower.Finish a day of sightseeing with a glass of wine, sipped on the furnished terrace overlooking the valley, or an espresso from the villa’s machine, savored while browsing via Wi-Fi. But the highlight of the villa’s amenities might be the Roman-bath-inspired spa reached by hidden staircase, where warm water and in-pool seating invite you to stay and soak a while.Floor-to-ceiling glass bathes the warm red-brick walls of this vacation rental in light for a look that’s both industrial and inviting. The design is, like much of modern Italy, cool but not cold, with a cluster of sofas in the living room, mid-century walnut dining chairs in the dining area, and a marble breakfast bar in the fully equipped kitchen.Each of the 2 bedrooms at this luxury property has a king bed, ensuite bathroom, and air conditioning; one of the bedrooms also has direct access to the indoor pool area. Like the main living areas, the bedrooms pair textured brick walls with sleek glass ones, and invite you to sit on mid-century-inspired armchairs.Once part of a bustling palace, this villa is still at the heart of the action, close to restaurants where you can relive your honeymoon over a bottle of local wine and markets where you can pick up produce for a family dinner. It’s also a wonderful base for day trips during your holiday, with Florence, Lucca, and Pisa 30 minutes away, and Siena 40 minutes away by car.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: From mountain views and lavish outdoor spaces to modern design, Villa Larino has everything you need for a Tuscan vacation in style. Located in the hills just east of Pisa, the four-bedroom villa puts the Tuscan landscape just outside your windows, and the region’s towns and cities within easy driving distance.Take advantage of Villa Larino’s sun-soaked hilltop location in one of its outdoor spaces: a saltwater pool, pool deck filled with chaise longues, shower, grill, wood-burning oven, pergola or dining area. You can even breathe some fresh air into your workout routine at the small covered outdoor gym. Inside, there are video games and an iPod dock for entertainment, Wi-Fi access for convenience and air conditioning for comfort.The villa’s decor juxtaposes traditional elements like brick hearths, beamed ceilings and terracotta floors with modern furnishings—think sleek cream leather sofas and cool Lucite chairs in the living room. The dining room pairs a hefty wooden Parsons-style table with Louis Ghost chairs for an effect that’s both rustic and chic. In the fully equipped modern kitchen, minimalist white cabinets support a graphic black breakfast bar.Each of the property’s four bedrooms has air conditioning, a television and views of both the garden and mountains. Whimsical details like looped metal headboards and filigreed Lucite lamps and nightstands make each room a stylish retreat. All four bedrooms have double beds, and one has an en-suite bathroom as well.Villa Larino is less than a mile from the nearest restaurant, in Alica, and about 4 km from the grocery store in Forcoli. You’ll find a gym in Peccioli, 5 km away, a restaurant in Palaia, about 6 km away, and a tennis club in Pontedera, about 9 km away. The town center and train station of Pontedera are 12 km away, the Castelfalfi golf club is 18 km away and the Pisa airport is just over 33 km away. Hit the slopes at Abetone, 110 km away, or the beach in Tirrenia, 42 km away.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: If you’re looking to immerse yourself in the vibrant culture, beautiful architecture, and ancient history of Florence, look no further. This downtown apartment is located right in the heart of Florence’s historical center, with its balcony overlooking one of the city’s major piazzas. Recently renovated, Capital features a delightful mix of luxurious modern amenities, and authentic Old-World design, with many of its ancient features still intact. Just step outside your front door, and you’ll be on the winding stone streets of Florence, with many of the city’s most famous monuments minutes away.From the parquet floors to the fresco ceilings, Capital is designed with authentic elegance, grace, and the Old World ambiance of Florence. No expense was spared when decorating Capital’s dining areas, living room, state of the art kitchen, and four en-suite bedrooms. Throughout the villa, you’ll find the finest designer furniture, high-end electronics, and lavish fixtures. And, you’ll love people watching from the balcony’s exciting city view.Capital’s fully equipped kitchen comes with a dishwasher, ice maker, and a Nespresso machine, as well as everything else you’ll need to prepare amazing meals. The formal dining area seats twelve, and there’s a small alfresco set on the balcony that is the perfect place to enjoy your morning coffee. The villa is also outfitted with Wi-Fi, television, and a stereo system. And, it comes with daily housekeeping during your stay.From Capital’s convenient location, you’ll have no trouble finding your way to attractions like Ponte Vecchio, Piazza del Duomo, and Riccardi Medici Palace. At the Galleria dell Accademia you can visit Michelangelo’s masterpiece sculpture, David. If you’re in the mood for fine Italian cuisine, the Michelin-starred Borgo San Jacopo, located along the Arno River, is one of the country’s finest restaurants. And, if you’d like to see where the locals spend their nights out, cross the river to Piazza Santo Spirito, which is home to a proper Tuscan street market, and plenty of bars, restaurants, and cafes.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Villa Gilda is a beautiful villa set in a peaceful and rural location near the baroque town of Noto, an idyllic base for exploring the rural south-east coast of Sicily.A modern structure made of pale, local stone, the villa sits gracefully on a hillside overlooking olive groves which stretch to the coast. The garden has been landscaped to enhance the surroundings, incorporating olive trees and traditional stone walls with palms, cactus and a smooth green lawn. Guests are encouraged to enjoy outside living to the full. You can help yourself to fruit and vegetables grown in the garden, cool off in the inviting pool, have a siesta on a sun lounger and dine together under a pergola.The uncluttered interiors of Villa Gilda have a clean, modern finish throughout with carefully chosen furniture and furnishings in a neutral colour palette of contemporary grey, white and beige. The living space is on the ground floor with a modern kitchen and a comfortable living room which opens out to the terrace, furnished with an outside sofa and chairs. Downstairs there are three bedrooms, each with their own bathroom and french windows opening out to the garden.Despite its rural location, Villa Gilda is just 10 minutes drive from the baroque town of Noto with its shops, restaurants and attractive historic centre. Enjoyable day trips include visiting the fishing village of Marzamemi, exploring nearby sandy beaches and visiting the Vendicari nature reserve, known for its flamingos.

listing.listing_description: A renovated farmhouse nestled on a private estate, Villa Leonardo charms with cozy interiors and lush garden. The 12 acre grounds provide peace, quiet and spectacular views of the countryside near Montespertoli, in the heart of Chianti, but Florence is just 30 minutes away. Take a break from it all in beautifully restored surroundings, or use the villa as a base for exploring Tuscany.Villa Leonardo is well suited to both play and work, if you must. Drive through the property’s remote-controlled gate and onto the gravel courtyard in front of the vine-covered house. At the back of the house, a long terrace has sunny areas for lounging and a covered area for al fresco dining. The fenced-in pool has its own patio, complete with chaise longues and umbrellas. If you can’t completely unplug, the villa does have a computer, printer, fax machine and Wi-Fi access.Inside, the villa is charming and cozy. Beamed ceilings, painted wood trim, brick floors and a fireplace make the living room feel rustic and casual, while accents like wrought-iron furniture and a chandelier in the dining room add a touch of elegance. The spacious eat in kitchen pairs state-of-the-art appliances with a cheery tile backsplash and farmhouse-style shelving, and opens to the terrace.Villa Leonardo’s six bedrooms are spread out over two floors. On the ground floor, one bedroom has two twin beds and a private adjacent bathroom, and the second bedroom has two twin beds, an en-suite bathroom and access to the garden. The other four bedrooms, all on the second floor, have optional air conditioning and en-suite bathrooms. There are two bedrooms with king beds, and two bedrooms with two twin beds each.During your stay, take time to visit the nearby medieval village of Montespertoli, once owned by the Machiavelli family and now a hotspot for wine festivals. Horseback riding, tennis and golf are also close by, or if you’re looking for a more urban adventure, make the 30 km drive to Florence. Just a bit farther are San Gimignano, 34 km away; Siena, 65.9 km away; and Pisa, 72.4 km away.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

feature.strong: What to do in the Chianti region of Tuscany?
feature.p: Don't miss a visit to the town of Montespertoli, in the center of the Chianti region. "A terrace overlooking the world" is the most accurate definition of this lovely town, which boasts views from high above Florence and convenient proximity to other large tourist areas of Tuscany. Montespertoli considers itself one of the capitals of Tuscan wine, and each year from the last Sunday in May to the first Sunday in June, holds a Chianti Wine Festival and a Stamp Exhibition about wine and vines. The first weekend after November 6th is the time for a local festival for "Vino Novello." The medieval town of Montespertoli had an important role due to its road network, which permitted Florence to carry out commerce in the direction of Volterra and Siena. Worth a visit is the castle which flanks Montespertoli (it belonged to the Machiavellis) and the "Museum of Sacred Art" located in the ample and beautiful presbytery of the Pieve of San Piero in Mercato. The precious paintings, silverworks and hangings are testimony of the historical and artistic importance of the area.

listing.listing_description: Villa Chianti Fornace is an exquisite country villa in the Chianti region of central Tuscany. Situated in a secluded, rustic setting just five minutes from Tavarnelle Val di Pesa, the villa features beautiful, panoramic views of the surrounding hills and villages, extraordinary indoor and outdoor living and dining areas, and a deluxe private spa. With six superb bedrooms, this vacation rental is ideal for family reunions and momentous occasions in the heart of Tuscan wine country.The gorgeously landscaped estate welcomes you with an enchanting pathway flanked by cypress trees, while lovely lemon and olive trees populate the gardens. Down a flight of stone steps from the villa's back entrance, the swimming pool terrace features elegant loungers and parasols on a smooth stone deck overlooking the countryside. Savor a delicious soak in the jetted hot tub and plunge into the pool for a morning swim. Kindle the stone barbeque grill and enjoy an alfresco meal in the dining pavilion, paired with local wine. Linger in the lounge as the children play on the charming swing set in the afternoon light.Arched French doors open from the yard to a lovely living room, with wicker sofas, stone floors, exposed wood ceiling beams, and fireplace. Savor aperitivi by the fire, prepare classic Italian feasts in the stunning kitchen, and join each other around the six-person dining table beneath the gorgeous chandelier. After dinner, repair to the billiard room for a game of pool and a fine digestivo from the deluxe bar. In the morning, refresh your body in the private spa, with sauna, Jacuzzi, and steam bath.The villa features four bedrooms in its main house—three with double size beds, one with two twins—all with walk-in closets and ensuite bathrooms of travertine marble. The guest house has two additional bedrooms—one with double bed, one with two twins—along with its own kitchen, dining area, and bathrooms.Your location offers a supreme balance of seclusion and convenience. You're just five minutes from the enchanting medieval town of Tavarnelle Val di Pesa, while Florence, Radda, Siena, Gaiole, and San Gimignano are all within thirty to forty minutes—allowing for fantastic daytrips before returning to this private paradise.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Rolling hills, a fairy-tale stone house and rustic-chic interiors: you’ll find it all at Villa Federico. Tucked into the countryside outside Siena, this luxury vacation rental in Tuscany will quickly entrance you with its idyllic setting and beautiful indoor and outdoor living areas. It’s the perfect rural Italian escape for an unforgettable holiday with friends or family.Weekdays at Villa Federico begin with complimentary breakfast service, after which you can nestle into the study with a book or step outside to claim a lounge chair by the pool. As the sun sinks toward the hills, heat up the barbecue and linger into the evening over a bottle of local wine at the al-fresco dining area.The villa’s interiors combine the charm of the past with the comforts of the present. High ceilings, terracotta floors and plenty of French doors with landscape views set a traditional tone that’s matched by a roll-arm sofa and bergere chairs around an open-hearth fireplace in the living room, and a farmhouse-style table with slipcovered seating for six in the dining room. The incredible kitchen is fully equipped and even has a wood-burning stove and doors out to the patio.Villa Federico’s seven bedrooms are divided between the five-bedroom main house and two one-bedroom annexes. The main house has two bedrooms with queen beds, two with twin beds and one with a French bed; all have en-suite bathrooms and several have jetted tubs as well. Each annex has a queen bed (or two twin beds), en-suite bathroom and kitchenette, and one has its own jetted tub. With their separate, private entrances, the annexes could be used as honeymoon suites or in-law retreats.The best way to see Tuscany is to set off into the rolling hills on foot or on a bicycle. The property is just a short drive from the town of San Casciano dei Bagni, where you’ll find shops, local restaurants and cafes, and a legendary thermal spa that’s been soothing visitors for centuries. If you’d like to explore further, the towns of Cetona and Orvieto are close enough for a day trip.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

feature.strong: What to do in the San Casciano dei Bagni region of Tuscany?
feature.p: Take a visit to the renowned thermal spa in San Casciano dei Bagni. It was the Etruscans who first discovered the healing properties of the thermal waters in Val d'Orcia. In the 17th century, the renowned Medici family built a series of baths, which have been reborn as a luxurious new spa featured in Travel & Leisure.

The enchanting town of Cetona will charm you with its cobblestone streets and medieval architecture. This lovely village has grown in popularity as a home for international artists and socialites. Stop for an exquisite lunch or dinner at Osteria Vecchia (so good!)—you won't be disappointed.
Definitely worth a visit are Orvieto, Assisi and Todi. Head to Deruta to shop for the renowned local ceramics. Last but not least, make sure to check out the chocolate museum in Perugia!

listing.listing_description: Clinging to the rocks of the Amalfi Coast, this seventeenth-century cliffside home is situated for incredible Ocean views, with many unique vantage points throughout its spacious grounds. With five luxurious bedrooms and plenty of indoor/outdoor shared spaces, Pamina is a great place to throw a family reunion or special event, like a destination wedding. Imagine the pictures.Pamina’s exterior decor features lush greenery, ancient vines, fruit trees, and bare-stone, all of which convey the villa’s harmonious existence with its natural surroundings, a trend that continues throughout the interior. The terracotta flooring tiles, splashes of turquoise, wood furniture, and a natural-rock wall in one of the lounge areas all pay homage to Italy’s coast. Moving to the bedrooms, Pamina has two king-bed rooms, two queens, and two doubles. And, all of the bedrooms have en-suite bathrooms.Pamina comes stocked with basic grocery items, and a maid visits daily to take care of the house, as well as make breakfast for the guests, which you can enjoy at the breakfast table, formal dining area, or at the alfresco set on the terrace. After breakfast, relax inside with television, Wi-Fi, and air conditioning. To beat the afternoon heat, hop in the refreshing swimming pool or find a shady spot on one the terrace living spaces and gaze upon the endless ocean view.Lined with gorgeous beaches, dynamic cliffs and mountains, and beautiful cities, Italy’s Amalfi Coast is great for day trips. Sorrento and Amalfi Town are both about fifteen kilometers from Pamina. Head a little further, and you can visit Naples, a legendary city for art and architectural history. If you feel like sticking close to home, Positano Beach and the town square are just a twenty-minute walk. There, you’ll find shops, restaurants, nightlife, and beautiful beachfront.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Enjoy a Tuscan retreat that’s both quiet and secluded and convenient to the region’s cities at Villa Vianci. Originally built as a summer home where noble families could escape the heat, the restored seven-bedroom property offers an escape from the pressures of modern life without sacrificing modern conveniences. Located just off the highway between Florence and Siena outside the town of Staggia Senese, it’s in the center of Tuscany without being in the thick of things.The elegant three-story home is approached through a gated courtyard and surrounded by vineyards and cypress groves. There’s a pool with outdoor shower as well as a charcoal barbecue, outdoor dining area and plenty of lounge chairs for sunbathing. Thanks to the recent restoration, the interiors are air-conditioned and have Wi-Fi access. The property’s caretakers live on the premises, making it easy to get assistance if needed.The living areas of Villa Vianci prove that stately spaces can be comfortable, too. In the sitting rooms, terrazzo floors covered by Persian rugs, paneled walls and original moldings create an elegant envelope that’s filled by traditional-style wooden furniture and plush sofas pulled up to a fireplace. The formal dining room continues the theme with cool mint-green walls and antique sideboards. The kitchen, however, is fresh and modern, with white cabinets, black and white tile floors and marble countertops.Each of the villa’s six bedrooms has air conditioning but is just as elegantly decorated as the property’s common spaces. There are five bedrooms with king or queen beds, each of which has its own ensuite bathroom. The remaining two bedrooms share a bathroom; one has two twin beds, and the other has two twin beds that can be converted into a queen bed.Villa Vianci is set on a hilltop outside the ancient town of of Staggia Senese. From the villa, it’s just over a mile to the town’s church, restaurant, tennis court and grocery store. The Castellina Scalo train station is about 3 km away and the Colle Val d’Elsa golf course is 8 km away. There’s a beach 77 km away, and a ski area 137 away. The cities of Siena and Florence are 17 and 45 km away, respectively.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.Note: The caretakers live on the premises of the villa, in a portion of the third floor with independent entrance.

listing.listing_description: This superb apartment is situated in the heart of Mayfair, in the West End of London, within walking distance or a short cab ride of Piccadilly Circus, Hyde Park, and the designer boutiques along Bond Street. The building was recently refurbished (ending in February 2018), which is reflected in the fresh, modern elegance of this private abode. Three bedrooms accommodate six guests in all, providing an ideal haven for families or groups of friends seeking stylish serenity and a prime location within this global capital of style and culture.The apartment features a beautiful salon area for savoring time with loved-ones. Comfortable sofas and armchairs face the flat-screen 4K TV with satellite channels, illuminated by ceiling lights, exquisite lamps, and a triptych of windows. The open kitchen is fully equipped and serves a breakfast bar with plush-covered chairs, as well as a gorgeous dining room with vaulted, skylight ceilings over a table for six. The décor is understated yet exquisite, with lovely touches of naturalistic artwork, lush potted plants, and chevron-patterned parquet floors extending throughout the home. Heating, air conditioning, and underfloor heating in the bathrooms keep you comfortable in all seasons.The master suite features a king bed accompanied by a TV, an exterior window, and a charming portal into the dining room, while its ensuite bathroom features a shower, tub, and dual vanity. Each of the two guest suites includes a double bed and ensuite bathroom, and one enjoys a pair of lovely French windows. Pendant lamps and beautiful pieces of original artwork frame each bed.The apartment's coveted location places you within minutes of countless destinations in central London. Enjoy a shopping excursion on Bond Street; meander through Hyde Park; admire the masterpieces of the National Gallery; and take in a play in the Theater District.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Ensconce yourself in modern luxury in the heart of London at Royalty Mews Penthouse. Thanks to its Soho location, this contemporary vacation rental puts the city's shopping, dining, historic sites and cultural attractions at your doorstep. Reserve its three bedrooms for an urban getaway with friends, a sightseeing holiday with family or even an active honeymoon in the thick of it all.Start each day with a coffee from the espresso machine, sipped at the al-fresco dining area on the villa's private terrace, or finish the evening with a glass of wine under the stars. A TV and sound system will help you unwind, Wi-Fi makes it easy to keep in touch, and both heating and air conditioning ensure your comfort no matter what the season-or the English weather.Thoughtfully designed and beautifully appointed, the penthouse embodies the best of sleek, modern British style. A nearly wall-to-wall sliding door floods the living room with light, while sculptural furniture is both lovely to look at and comfortable to sit in. A breakfast bar is an inviting focal point in the fully equipped kitchen, and there's also a dining table for four.Each of the three bedrooms at Royalty Mews Penthouse has a King bed; two of them have en-suite bathrooms and the third has shared access to a hall bathroom. Neutral tones give the bedrooms a serene ambience, and in the bathrooms, stone panels and on-trend brass-toned fixtures lend a spa-worthy appeal.During your stay, sample the Soho shopping and dining just outside the villa or take advantage of the location to walk to Piccadilly Circus, Trafalgar Square and Covent Garden to sightsee. The property is a 20-minute drive or less from sights such as Westminster Abbey, the London Eye, St. Paul's Cathedral, Buckingham Palace and the tower that houses Big Ben, so it's easy to tick off everything on your must-see list.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Please note that there is an ongoing construction project near this property. For more information, please contact a Villa Specialist.Put yourself into the perfect London pied-à-terre at Mayfair Two. Nestled into the heart of the Mayfair neighborhood, this bijou vacation rental is within walking distance of world-class shopping, dining, museums and more. Its one bedroom makes it just the right size for a couples getaway or a city honeymoon.After a day of sightseeing, come back to a villa with all the amenities of home: a TV, air conditioning and heating to keep you comfortable no matter what the London weather, and laundry facilities to ensure you’re ready for the next day’s adventures. Wi-Fi access makes it easy to stay in touch with friends and family.Mayfair Two’s bright, open-concept living and dining room takes its inspiration from the days of mod London, with a jewel-toned sofa and dining chairs, sleek accent tables and a plush beni ourain–style area rug. The separate kitchen has a practical galley layout and is fully equipped, with high-contrast white cabinets and glossy dark countertops.The villa’s single bedroom has a king bed, TV and en-suite bathroom. It’s a hotel-worthy private retreat with serene silver-toned carpet and wallpaper, floor-length drapes, built-in storage and subtly mid-century-inspired nightstands. Plenty of stone tile gives the bathroom a vibe of spa-like luxury.You could easily spend a holiday exploring the shops and restaurants of this part of Mayfair. Hunt down one-of-a-kind finds at the Dover Street Market, or browse the boutiques on New Bond Street, Oxford Street and Regent Street. The apartment is less than a 15-minute walk from iconic London destinations such as Hyde Park and Piccadilly Circus and, for royal fans, it’s less than a 20-minute drive to Kensington Palace and Buckingham Palace. It’s also less than half an hour by taxi—or Tube—to must-sees such as Westminster Abbey, Big Ben and the London Eye.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Scudo is a fashionable luxury property set in an exclusive location in the heart of Florence! On the third floor of a historical Florentine palazzo with an elevator, Scudo has been completely transformed into a calming and serene urban oasis. And while Scudo is an elegant and very sophisticated apartment, you will feel both welcome and exceptionally comfortable. Get the holiday you deserve!Kick back in this most sophisticated area of Tuscany. This vacation rental features a sauna, so you can get into that sweet relaxed mood any time of day. Other perks at this private apartment include satellite television and Wi-Fi. For an extra cost, you can also receive cooking, housekeeping and babysitting services, as well as villa pre-stocking and airport transfers. Just ask our dedicated concierge so you can hit your vacation running!This exquisite four-bedroom apartment boasts traditional architecture that dates back to the 1600s. A clever monochromatic palette unifies the entire space including the minimalistic furnishings with clean lines. Lounge around in the living area with an eye for retro-inspired design. The stylish formal dining area includes seating for eight and lies adjacent the fully equipped gourmet kitchen.Four magnificent bedrooms accommodate up to eight guests at this non-smoking apartment. Three bedrooms offer en-suite bathrooms. The fourth bedroom will enjoy access to the hall bathroom with a jetted tub. The master suite offers a king bed, a fireplace and a lounge. All of the sleeping quarters provide air conditioning.Scudo makes a great bet for a family holiday or a decadent honeymoon in Italy. You will be situated in lovely downtown Florence and within walking distance of Piazza del Duomo. The famous towns of Montalcino, Montepulciano and Pienza are all within easy driving distance and well worth a visit. As you will soon find out, Tuscan cuisine is itself quite simple, focusing on natural flavors – and perhaps therein lies some part of the secret to what Italians call la dolce vita, or living ‘the sweet life.’ Book your stay today with Luxury Retreats!Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Vacation in high aristocratic style at the five-bedroom Villa Spada. Built in the 1700s as a hunting lodge for the Spada family, this restored home near Lucca offers historic elegance with modern comforts. Families or groups of up to ten will appreciate the manicured gardens, antique furnishings and panoramic views of the Tuscan hills.Pass by the villa’s stone lions to enter the lush grounds and terraced gardens, including a walled formal garden. Stroll beneath cypress and lemon trees and hibiscus, or catch up on reading in the shade of a centuries-old lime tree. Take in the view with your morning espresso or evening aperitif from the dining area on the terrace, or lounge by the pool. A baby kit is available for the youngest travelers; for adults, there’s Wi-Fi access.The heart of Villa Spada is a gracious living room that opens to the terrace through French doors. Throughout the house, you’ll find antique furnishings and paintings and original moldings. In the large, airy living rooms, the more ornate details are balanced by comfortable modern sofas and neutral tones. The eat-in kitchen has a food processor and dishwasher, plus traditional stone work surfaces and a corner fireplace.The villa’s bedrooms have an equally lovely mix of old and new, pairing antique wooden beds and desks with jaunty striped rugs and walls. There are three bedrooms with king beds, two of which have en-suite bathrooms and one of which has a bathroom with tub. The fourth bedroom has a twin bed and bathroom with tub, and the fifth bedroom has two single beds and a shared bathroom.Villa Spada’s location makes it easy to explore the region. If you’ve forgotten anything, the grocery store in Valpromaro is just 5 minutes away. Pack your racquets for a trip to the tennis court in San Concordio di Mariano, 5 km away, or your clubs for a round at the Forte dei Marmi golf course, about 30 km away. A 18 km drive will take you the center of Lucca, and a 53 km drive brings you to the Pisa airport or beach at Viareggio.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Escape to classic French Riviera charm—with a contemporary twist—at La Calado. Pretty and traditional on the outside, chic and modern on the inside, this Antibes vacation rental is a wonderfully stylish retreat. At five bedrooms and a short distance from downtown, it’s the perfect size for reconnecting with family and the perfect spot for exploring the area with friends.Private gardens filled with cypress and olive trees, lavender and rosemary bring a little piece of the French countryside to the villa’s quiet neighborhood just minutes from Antibes. Savor the scents and sunshine from terraces with a heated pool and lounging and dining areas. In the evenings, flip on the Apple TV, surround-sound system and Wi-Fi, or treat yourself to a session in the hammam or a glass from the wine cellar.While the original villa is a Belle Epoque gem, this luxury property has been lovingly restored to a bright, modern finish. Parquet floors, pale wood accents and white walls link the living room and dining room, and doors lead into a fully equipped kitchen with a stunning waterfall marble breakfast bar.Each of the five bedrooms at La Calado has a king bed and en-suite bathroom, as well as the same considered style as the main living areas. Details such as exposed ceiling beams and cozy window seats lend charm, while in the bathrooms, patterned tile has spa-worthy appeal.Spend your holiday ensconced in the villa or sightseeing around the Riviera. It’s a short drive from the residence to shopping, dining and ancient fortifications in the old town area of Antibes, and to popular, sandy Salis Beach. Relive your honeymoon over a drink at the exclusive Hotel du Cap-Eden Rock or make the short drive to Cannes for a stroll along the famous Croisette.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Find innovative design alongside classic Amalfi Coast scenery at Villa Galidia. This seaside vacation rental is filled with clever architecture and inspiring artwork. What’s more, its perch high above the water is only a few minutes’ walk from shopping, dining and more in the town of Sorrento. Reserve this four-bedroom luxury property for a laid-back holiday with friends or a trip spent exploring the area with family.Your stay at Villa Galidia includes daily housekeeping and continental breakfast. When you’ve finished sipping your morning coffee at the al-fresco dining table, shift to a lounger in the sun or stretch out in the indoor exercise room. In the evenings, stay outside around the barbecue and hot tub, or relax inside with the help of the smart TV and Wi-Fi.The villa’s bright, beautiful rooms are a thoughtful pairing of the traditional and modern. Refined sofas sit under high ceilings and geometric wallpaper in the living room, while a contemporary staircase floats above the table in the dining room. The inviting kitchen is fully equipped and has a breakfast area.Villa Galidia has one bedroom with a king bed and a private en-suite bathroom. There is one other bedroom with a king bed, and two bedrooms with queen beds. These three bedrooms have shared access to a hall bathroom, but direct access to a terrace or balcony.If you can tear yourself away from the villa’s spectacular views over the Mediterranean Sea, it’s less than a 10-minute walk to the town center of Sorrento, where you can browse local boutiques or sit down to a honeymoon-worthy dinner at a waterfront eatery. The villa is also a short drive from the town of Positano and its beach, as well as the must-see ruins of Pompeii.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Steal away to a sunny retreat with a secret garden in the heart of London at Pembroke. Set in an elegant townhouse in the city’s fashionable Kensington area, this charming vacation rental is bright and vintage-inspired, and opens to a lovely private outdoor space. Use its three bedrooms for a sightseeing holiday with family, a getaway with other couples or even a city honeymoon.On warmer mornings, bring your coffee out to the house’s walled terrace to sip; on sunny afternoons, relax with a glass of wine in the al-fresco sitting area. In cooler weather, a TV, sound system and Wi-Fi inside make it easy to relax after a busy day exploring London.Pembroke opens to an inviting living area that stretches the full length of the house, with a living room at the front featuring built-in bookcases, a fireplace and a window seat overlooking the front garden, and a conservatory at the back that opens to stairs into the garden. Downstairs, the fully equipped kitchen has a breakfast bar and gorgeous cabinetry in a deep blue. It’s adjacent to a TV lounge and a dining room that also has garden access.This luxury residence has three bedrooms with double beds: one with an en-suite bathroom and two that share a bathroom. Like the rest of the house, the bedrooms are bright and spacious, with pretty, traditional details such as built-in cabinets, paneled walls and floor-length drapes.The villa’s prime Kensington location means it’s less than a 10-minute drive from attractions such as Harrods and Hyde Park, and less than a 20-minute drive from Westminster Abbey and Buckingham Palace. It’s well worth traveling a bit farther to see the splendor of St. Paul’s Cathedral, delve into British history at the Tower of London or peek behind the scenes of the Harry Potter films on the Warner Brothers studio tour.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Set on a hilltop in Chianti, villa Le Pratola offers views in every direction and something for every member of the family. Kids will love the pool and games room, while adults will appreciate the proximity to Siena and Florence. Five air-conditioned bedroom suites and nearly five acres of gardens mean there’s room for everyone to spread out.The villa is well-equipped for exploring or relaxing. Take a swim in the infinity pool, go head-to-head in the games room or at the pool table and work up a sweat in the compact gym. There’s a wood-burning outdoor barbecue, and a dining area in the stone courtyard where you can enjoy what you’ve grilled. Relax on loungers around the pool or take advantage of the Wi-Fi access indoors.Le Pratola’s stone walls and beamed ceilings are a traditional envelope for striking modern interiors. In the living room, a sleek sectional is pulled up to an original fireplace surround, and a red Lucite coffee table and striped chair add fun, glamorous touches. The dining room is open and airy, with a large arched window, and the state-of-the-art kitchen pairs stone countertops with glossy red cabinets.Each of the villa’s five air-conditioned bedrooms has an en-suite bathroom stocked with a hairdryer and toiletries. There are three bedrooms with queen beds, the master with a super king size bed and one of which also has a sofa bed. The fifth bedroom has two twin beds as well as a trundle bed. The villa has five bedrooms overall: Four bedrooms on the top floor, with an additional bedroom on the ground floor, located across the courtyard with a private entrance. For the smallest guests, baby equipment like a crib, highchair and booster seat is available.Though Le Pratola offers the peace and panoramas of a location in rural Chianti, it’s just over a mile from the Pozze di Lecchi restaurant, and about 2 miles from a grocery store, church and town center. You’ll find a train station and the Siena hospital 9 miles away, and it’s a 2-hour drive to the airport.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Chalet Les Anges is a spectacular luxury home at Zermatt, one of the prime jewels of the Swiss Alps. Situated in a peaceful setting about ten minutes on foot from the heart of the village and ski slopes, the chalet feels like a private resort unto itself, with superb outdoor living areas, high-end wellness amenities, and outstanding staff and services including a private chef. The ideal position offers privileged privacy and breathtaking views of the Matterhorn, while placing you within easy reach of world-class dining and sporting destinations. With ample and flexible accommodations for up to fourteen guests (including four king suites), this child-friendly vacation rental is ideal for large or multiple families.The chalet was built in a classic alpine style with natural timber and beautiful stone masonry. Multiple balconies and a spacious deck offer ample room for savoring the open-air pleasures of Switzerland, including alfresco meals in the warmer months and soothing whirlpool soaks as you gaze at the Matterhorn's iconic profile.Inside, the vaulted, open-plan great room features expansive, mountain-view windows, lovely sitting areas surrounding a three-sided modern hearth, a gorgeous grand piano, and a lovely dining area opening to the deck. The kitchen is fully equipped with high-grade gourmet appliances, while superb media features include a home theater and iPod docking station. Your vacation rental comes with chef services six days per week, a villa manager, and a fine selection of beverages including champagne, spirits, and wine.Four bedrooms suites boast king beds, while the three guestrooms feature pairs of twin beds that can be arranged as split-kings. All of the rooms enjoy ensuite bathrooms with tubs and showers, as well as air conditioning. The master suite includes its own fireplace and gazes out on spectacular mountain views.There is hardly a finer location at Zermatt for groups seeking serene privacy along with convenient access to the slopes and town. You’ll find restaurants, bars, wellness amenities, grocery stores, and the local train station within a ten-minute walk of the chalet, as well as some of the world's finest skiing, hiking, and mountaineering.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Watch the light move across the Matterhorn from the comfort of your own living room at the beautiful Chalet Grace. From the villa’s south-facing perch in the exclusive Petit Village area of Zermatt, you’ll have incredible views and an even better location close to shopping, dining and the Sunnegga Express ski lift. Invite up to twelve friends or family members for an unforgettable holiday in the Swiss Alps.Your stay at this luxury property includes the services of a chef and villa manager, as well as champagne, house wines and spirits. On warmer evenings, dine outside by the barbecue and al-fresco table; on cooler nights, soak under the stars in the private outdoor whirlpool tub or unwind inside with the help of the steam room, home theater, games room and Wi-Fi.Pale wood details, panoramic windows and elegant furnishings help Chalet Grace live up to its name. The heart of the villa is a stunning two-level great room with a living area on the first floor and a dining area on the upper story. While chef service is provided on six days out of seven, there is a fully equipped kitchen available.Each of the five bedrooms at this vacation rental has a king bed, en-suite bathroom and television. Pastel tones, soft textures and country-inspired furnishings give the bedrooms a chic yet peaceful feel.The chalet is a 10-minute walk from the heart of Zermatt town, where you can browse the shops, stock up at the grocery store, sample local restaurants or take a honeymoon-worthy stroll down its pedestrian-friendly streets. It’s also a 2-minute drive from the Sunnegga Express ski lift and, if you’re visiting during the warmer season, a 20-minute drive from the nearest golf course.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Why compromise on your vacation? Villa Marchesa is a modern mansion with traditional style, a secluded country estate that’s still close to town. Nestled into private woodlands on the Maremma coast of Tuscany, the nine-bedroom property is near both beaches and cities. Larger groups can rent its sister villa, located on the same estate.The villa’s centerpiece is its three pools, linked by waterfalls and adjoined by a pool house. After a swim or a day of sightseeing, relax in the sauna and jetted tub and sip an aperitif at the al fresco dining area. The villa itself is both air conditioned and heated and is equipped with high-speed Internet and a printer. Fitness buffs will appreciate the gym; others can enjoy some low-key games in the billiards room.Inspired by historic Tuscan country houses, Villa Marchesa’s interiors are rustic yet sophisticated. Light stone floors, brick arches and pale-wood beamed ceilings put a modern spin on farmhouse architecture, and purple and fuchsia upholstery and accents are an unexpected touch. Instead of the traditional fireplace, there’s a hearth surrounded by seating. Multiple seating and dining areas and a quiet study ensure there’s space to spread out, and the fully equipped eat-in kitchen has two gas ranges.Each of the property’s nine bedrooms has an en-suite bathroom, air conditioning and Internet access. There’s one bedroom with a king bed, one bedroom with a double bed, two bedrooms with queen beds, and four bedrooms with two twin beds each. The ninth bedroom is in a more private annex and has two twin beds.Villa Marchesa is just over 2 miles from the nearest town and a 20-minute drive from the regional center of Grosseto. If you’re after sun and sand, the beaches of Scarlino and Punta Ala are 30 minutes by car; if art and architecture are more your speed, drive to Siena, 40 minutes away, or Florence, 90 minutes away. The nearest airport is in Pisa, about 100 minutes away.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: With accommodations for seven in downtown Chelsea, the fashion district, it doesn’t get any easier to explore the many wonders of Central London. Big Ben, Hyde Park, Buckingham Palace, Piccadilly Circus, and so many more world famous attractions are located within twenty-minutes drive. And, when it comes to culture, nightlife, fine dining, and shopping, you won’t have any trouble finding something new and exciting in Chelsea, there’s plenty to see within a short walk from Prince Luxe.This purple pastel townhouse is located just off King’s Road in the middle of an adorable line of houses that showcase Chelsea’s stylish and cheerful way of life. Once inside, you’ll love the modern-elegant ambiance created by a soft color scheme, contemporary furniture, and sleek, high-end electronics, appliances, and fixtures. The kitchen is beautifully designed, with integrated appliances and plenty of functional workspaces.Prince Luxe comes with a fully equipped kitchen and offers two great spaces for dining in. First, the elegant dining room, with a mirrored accent wall and seating for six, it is perfect for formal occasions. The second option is the alfresco set on the rooftop patio; it’s a great spot to drink your morning coffee and plan out another exciting day in London.Enjoying a laidback brunch is a favorite pastime of Chelsea residents, and places like Bluebird, Tom’s Kitchen, and Eelbrook are among the most popular spots. After brunch, you could check out Stamford Bridge, the stadium where Chelsea FC play, you’ll see their fans and colors just about everywhere in Chelsea. Just off Sloane Square, the Saatchi Gallery is an incredible contemporary art museum housed in an old military building from the turn of the eighteenth-century. At dinner, Gordon Ramsay’s three-Michelin starred restaurant is nearby on Royal Hospital Road. And, you’ll want to check out local pubs like Chelsea Potter and McGettigan’s, or popular dance clubs Raffles and JuJu for some late night fun.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: If you’re after a Tuscan vacation with historic ambience, look no further than Buonvisi. Built in the 16th century and recently restored, the villa is rich in both original details and 21st-century touches like a pool and Wi-Fi. Its location on the Fattoria Mansi Bernardini estate gives guests access to resort-like amenities such as a restaurant and shared tennis court.The stately house and its piano nobile overlook a wide, flat lawn and inground pool. Serve dinner hot off the outdoor grill at the al fresco dining area, or ask the estate staff to prepare a local favorite. In the summer, stroll the grounds, rest in the mature trees’ shade or bring your racquet to the shared tennis court; in the winter, cozy up to one of several fireplaces.The villa’s charm lies in its mix of preserved original features, like ornate fireplaces, beamed ceilings and moldings, and comfortable modern furnishings. Gather the whole family in one of several seating areas in the spacious living room, or retreat to a seat by the fire in the snug library. The roomy kitchen also has a fireplace and traditional indoor barbecue, plus more modern features like a microwave, coffee machine and dishwasher.Buonvisi’s eight bedrooms are spread across its two floors. On the ground floor, a double bedroom with en-suite bathroom offers a more private space. Upstairs, there are four bedrooms with double beds, and three with two twin beds each. All have en-suite bathrooms, and the same architectural charm as the common areas—think beamed ceilings and tiled floors.The estate is just 2 km from the shops and post office in the town of Segromigno in Monte, and less than 12 km from the Renaissance architecture in the city of Lucca. It’s also less than 45 km to the resort town of Forte dei Marmi and its renowned beaches. If you’d like to explore more of Italy, Pisa’s airport is about 37 km away, and Florence is just under 60 km.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

feature.p: HEATING - Heating is available at an additional charge of 50 Euro per day and must be paid directly on the spot to the owner or his/her representative before departing. Please note that heating in Italy, when not subject to restrictions by the local Government, is more expensive compared to other countries. If you look for a property in low season, make sure to ask for an estimate of the heating cost. You may be asked a supplementary deposit for heating expenses.

WATER AND ELECTRICITY - Please note that most of the properties that we offer are not the typical purpose-built Mediterranean holiday villas. Most are converted farmhouses or former manor houses, full of character and history. Water shortages do occur; please use it sparingly during the summer months. At the same time, Italy is probably one of the few countries in the world where the government has introduced a system of electricity limitators to contain the national consumption. This means you must be careful when using more than one appliance at once because the limitator will shut the electricity off.

listing.listing_description: Standing majestically in a beautiful parkland, Villa Lenka is an aristocratic 17th century villa offering the discerning traveler Tuscan living at its finest. The villa is nestled amid tranquil Italian gardens through which flows a fresh water brook into two small lakes overlooked by a shady weeping willow tree. Discover the magical beauty of Villa Lenka and enjoy inspired moments of harmony, relaxation and refinement this year in Tuscany!The grand cypress trees and fragrant lemon and herb gardens create the perfect backdrop to the private swimming pool. Amid water features, ponds and a lush garden, alfresco dining is a pure delight. Or maybe you are in the mood to just curl up underneath the shade of the enchanting gazebo entwined in vines – which is also a special spot for a romantic moment or an inspiring toast! Among its countless features, the villa offers a wine cellar, a wood burning oven in the cellar, satellite television, DVD player and Wi-Fi. You will also find various games and a library. Your reservation includes a full staff with complimentary chef service and housekeeping.The large and spacious frescoed rooms filled with antique furnishings offer an air of elegance throughout, as modern conveniences blend beautifully with the rich heritage of this ancient family home. Charm and character abound throughout grand reception rooms a magnificent drawing room, a cozy television lounge, a card room, a Tuscan kitchen, a breakfast room and a lovely dining room. Overall, the villa has been decorated and furnished with an eye to the classic.The seven luxurious bedrooms accommodate up to fourteen guests in a sublimely sophisticated ambience. All of the bedrooms include en-suite bathrooms, air conditioning and heating. The master bedroom includes a king size bed, and you will find either queens or twins in the other guest suites. Fine linens and accoutrements offer splendid nights of rest.Built in 1624, Villa Lenka is set in a verdant valley in the southern hills of Lucca and was once summer residence to Count Cosimo Bernardini. The Bernardini family owned several palazzo’s in the city center as well as many villas in the surrounding hills. Come experience the opulence, history, culture and cuisine that have put Tuscany on the international map as one of the most coveted holiday areas in Europe!Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: From the outside, La Maccinaia looks like the well-preserved 17th-century Tuscan villa it is, with three stories of stone walls standing atop a hill in the heart of Chianti. On the inside, though, this seven-bedroom property is an intriguing mix of restored architectural features and modern furnishings, with a stunning kitchen at the center. If you want to explore the region, ask the on-site caretaker for local tips.The villa is perched on a hill, so the pool and terraces have beautiful views of the countryside. There’s an outdoor grill, plenty of chaise longues around the pool and a covered table for outdoor dining. Inside, the house’s 21st century features include air conditioning, a flat-screen television and Wi-Fi access. A guest house separate from the main villa offers its own living and dining areas, kitchenette and terrace.The interiors are an elegant mix of original features, like a fireplace, beamed ceilings and terracotta floors, and sleek modern furnishings, like minimalist white sofas and glass-topped tables. Contemporary art in the common areas and a few bedrooms makes for a colorful focal point. The standout white kitchen is laid out around an island fronted with stainless steel and topped with stone, but retains its brick ceiling and mullioned windows.There are five bedrooms in the main villa and two in the guest house. In the main villa, there are three bedrooms with queen beds: two with en-suite bathrooms and shared toilets, and one with bathroom access. The master suite has a king bed, en-suite bathroom and shared toilet, and the fifth bedroom has four twin beds that can be made into king beds and an en-suite bathroom. In the guest house, one bedroom has a double bed and the other has two twin beds; both have en-suite bathrooms. Additional accommodations can be arranged in a bedroom with bunk beds.La Maccinaia is located in a quiet area of Chianti between the villages of Gaiole and Castelnuovo Berardenga. If you’re looking for peace and seclusion, you’ll find it here; the nearest town is nearly 14 km away. If you are looking to explore the region, the closest city is Siena.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Wind your way to a romantic Amalfi Coast retreat at Villa Nume. Built around 1500 as a defensive fortification with a watchtower, this vacation rental offers twenty-first-century guests a quiet, private haven with attentive service and postcard-perfect views of the sea. Use the four bedrooms as a base for a family vacation exploring the Praiano area, or indulge in a sunny honeymoon here.Your holiday at Villa Nume includes daily continental breakfast and housekeeping, and cook service at lunch and dinner. A porter will be on hand at your arrival and departure to assist with the flights of steps down to the villa. This luxury property boasts a resort-worthy outdoor living area with an infinity pool, loungers facing the sea, daybeds for soaking in the Mediterranean sun and an al-fresco dining area. After sunset, listen to a favorite album on the sound system, catch a game on the satellite television or share photos of your day via Wi-Fi.The stunning oceanfront location is complemented by breathtaking interiors. Short flights of steps following the contours of the hill, arched stone ceilings and terracotta tile floors speak to the building’s past, but a recent renovation added subtle contemporary touches. In the living room, plush sofas and area rugs sit under gilt-edged mirrors and sconces with vintage elegance. There’s a formal dining area with seating for ten, and a breakfast nook off a fully equipped kitchen that’s replete with playful pops of color.Likewise, the upgraded bedrooms will satisfy modern guests. There are two bedrooms with queen beds, en-suite bathrooms and sea views, including a master suite that opens to its own terrace. A family suite with four twin beds (or two queen beds) and a shared bathroom is ideal for parents traveling with children, and the fourth bedroom, with its pair of twin beds and en-suite bathroom, is great for older kids or friends.Though Villa Nume’s perch on a mountain outcrop makes it feel like its own world, it’s only a 6 km drive from Conca dei Marini and the otherworldly Grotta dello Smeraldo, and a 8 km drive from lively Amalfi. Take the car and climb down the steps to the nearby beaches, including sandy Castiglione and quiet Atrani, or reserve a boat and discover hidden coves and soaring cliff faces from the water.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Spend days exploring the perfume capital of the world and nights mingling with the jet set along the French Riviera at Villa La Corniche. Named for the French word for cliff, this luxury vacation rental is perched above the city of Grasse, which has been producing fragrances for centuries. Book the property for a quiet getaway with friends and family, or as a private retreat from the film festival in downtown Cannes, just 15 minutes away.Take in sweeping views from the Southern Alps in the east to the Esterel Mountains in the west from the villa’s beautifully appointed terrace. More than an acre of gardens includes a heated pool, a sunny terrace with loungers and an al-fresco shower. Entertaining in the Riviera sunshine is a snap thanks to a pool house with a wine cellar, a barbecue, and outdoor dining tables for up to twenty-four guests. On cooler nights, step inside to gather around the satellite and Apple TVs; in the winter months, a gas fireplace will quickly dispel any chills.Recently renovated and thoughtfully designed, the open-concept interiors of Villa La Corniche are bright and modern. The inviting great room, encompassing sun-kissed sitting and dining areas and a fully equipped kitchen, welcomes guests with a mix of traditional and exotic pieces, from a tufted leather sofa to geometric poufs. Cozy up to the fireplace in the sitting area, or open the space to the terrace with several sets of French doors.The villa’s three bedrooms, all with en-suite bathrooms and shared balconies, can host parties of up to six on holiday together. There are two with king beds, including a master suite that boasts a fireplace and gorgeous views, and one with a queen bed.Though Villa La Corniche feels tranquil and relaxed, it’s less than a mile from downtown Grasse, where visitors can tour historic perfumeries such as Galimard, Fragonard and Molinard. Visit during the month of August to experience the Fête du Jasmin, or Jasmine Festival, when crowds gather in the street to watch a parade, performances and fireworks. Or spend a laid-back day driving the coastal roads between Cannes, Antibes and Nice—all within day-trip distance—finishing with a honeymoon-style dinner at an oceanfront restaurant.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: This stunning villa on Croatia's Split Riviera is situated outside the picturesque town of Primosten on the Adriatic coast, just steps from a small private beach. Built on a lofty slope, the three-story home commands breathtaking, panoramic views of the sea and islands from its multiple terraces and luminous interiors. Its gorgeous stone walls and gleaming white surfaces evoke the rustic charm of Dalmatia and timeless spirit of the ancient Mediterranean, while exquisite furnishings and high-end appliances embody contemporary Croatian elegance. With cooking and dining amenities on all three levels, the seven-bedroom villa forms an ideal haven for multiple couples, family reunions, and destination wedding guests.The expansive outdoor living areas welcome enchanting days and evenings in the Adriatic breeze, with room for festive gatherings or quiet, intimate moments. The lower terrace features a gem-toned swimming pool and lounge chairs for basking in the sunlight, while its sitting area and dining table inspire gourmet delights amid sublime vistas. The mid-level terrace boasts a lounge and a smaller dining table, and there is a spacious balcony above.A trio of arched doorways open into the main living area, infusing the open-concept space with the light and breath of the sea. The fully equipped kitchen serves a comfy TV salon and beautiful dining table. Kitchenettes and smaller living/dining areas accompany the upper-level bedrooms. The villa's two wine fridges will store the spoils of your local vineyard visits.The bedrooms are furnished and decorated with elegant simplicity, accentuating the natural light and exalting views. There are four suites with king beds and three with queen beds. Six of the bedrooms have ensuite bathrooms, and the top-floor bedroom enjoys a private balcony.The villa offers a lovely home base as you explore the Split Riviera and Dalmatian islands. You're within easy reach of several pebble beaches, suitable for swimming, snorkeling, diving and various watersports. Primosten is about five to ten minutes away on foot, and features excellent dining, shopping, nightlife, and medieval architectural gems. Drive east along the coast to historic Trogir and the heart of Split, or north to the precious splendors of Krka National Park.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: From its hilltop location, La Veduta di Vertine enjoys sweeping views of the Chianti Classico region’s olive groves, rolling hills, and dynamic sunsets. You and your guests are sure to appreciate the villa’s sixteenth-century architecture, rustic-chic decor, and carefully integrated touches of modern luxury. With five beautiful bedrooms and plenty of outdoor space, this villa can accommodate up to fourteen guests, making it perfect for a special occasion like a destination wedding, family reunion, or high-end corporate retreat.Tradition meets elegance at La Veduta di Vertine. Stately furniture, ornate floor coverings, and intricate stonework reside under vaulted exposed-beam ceilings, promoting a warm and welcoming, yet formal environment. Chandelier lighting and grand fireplaces set an intimate tone at night, while during the day, many hillside view framing windows and wide openings to the terrace create a playful open-air atmosphere. In the kitchen, your inner chef will be inspired by the restaurant caliber appliances and gourmet working environment.Outside, you’ll have over four-acres of olive groves and lawn to explore, a heated infinity pool, a bocce court, alfresco dining, fruit trees, and a small farm with chickens who will provide your group with fresh eggs. There’s also an outdoor grill and pizza oven to capture that authentic Old-World style of gourmet cooking. And, before dinner, make sure to select the perfect pairing from Vertine’s well-stocked wine cellar.Just a short walk from home, Castello di Vertine’s ancient walls still serve as a home to villagers of Vertine. This medieval castle has been standing since at least the eleventh century, with little change to the exterior. If you’re up for a drive, Florence, Pisa, Siena, and so many more breath-taking Tuscan villages are located within an hour, or so, from home. And, of course, you’ll want to spend as much time as you can wandering the ancient streets, castles, and wineries of Gaiola, just a few minutes away in Chianti.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Impressive large half-moon windows lined up across the industrial-chic steampunk living room add visual interest to the sophisticated deep gray, black, and white palette throughout this apartment. It’s a modern space for business entertaining with the compact gloss white L-kitchen or to meet up with old friends, or to see and be seen in one of the artsiest areas of London. Practically everything in Soho is within walking distance, taxi or tube from here.Berwick Street I is in a repurposed industrial building. A lift takes you to the door. A glass- walled entry with black accents creates the impression of open space. But, it’s a retro 50’s take on a business divider creating a structured flow from room to room. The layout is perfect for late afternoon cocktail parties or intimate after-theatre suppers. Dropping into your favorite fabric shops or searching for that rare, long-lost vinyl before heading back to change for cocktails and dinner with friends works perfectly here.Soho is the heart of the theatre district. All the little antique shops, delightful cafes, and restaurants, its jumble of clothing boutiques, fabric shops, and most notably rare record shops combine to shape and define this unique area.Ala-carte services are available for amenities like a private chef, grocery shopping, pre-stocking, or arranging any particular activities, or outings. Our concierge service is just a phone call away.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Explore the Sienese countryside from this secluded retreat overlooking the hills near San Gimignano. With a main house and 2 guest houses (each with its own kitchen and living areas), Villa Mugnello is perfect for families and large groups seeking expansive privacy near some of Tuscany's finest towns. Stroll the medieval streets of Radicondoli and return on foot to poolside relaxation and sunset feasts. Nestled on 2.2 hectares of private land with panoramic vistas, the villa sets the scene for peaceful escapes and special celebrations. Sip your morning espresso at the bistro tables by the swimming pool before dipping into the refreshing water. Kindle the barbecue and gather around the 20-person table to savor local delicacies from nearby markets. Open bottles of wine that you can only find in the hills stretching before you.The renovated interiors balance original antique features—barrel-vaulted brick ceilings, exposed timber beams—with freshly modern décor. Plentiful natural light infuses the living and dining areas, where white walls showcase gallery-worthy artwork. Open the windows to the summer breeze or curl up by the fire on an autumn evening. Take a favorite book into a quiet den or gather in the main-house living room for a festive night.The bedrooms balance rustic simplicity with beautiful touches of cheerful color and unique artwork. There are 8 queen bedrooms plus a kid-friendly twin bedroom in each Annex, both of which open to the garden. All of the bedrooms enjoy ensuite bathrooms, and several include private sitting areas. The center of Radicondoli is just 4 minutes away on foot, where you'll discover local cheeses at the caseificio (dairy), charming trattorias, and Renaissance splendors at Santi Simone e Giuda Church. Enjoy a daytrip to San Gimignano or Siena, or drive about 77 kilometers into Florence.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Pettolecchia La Residenza is your private masseria located in Fasano, the heart of Puglia on the “heel” of Italy. Dating from the fifteenth century, the property is a lasting example of the many masserie, or farms, that once dotted the region. Set on eight hectares of pastoral land and featuring accommodations for ten and an attentive staff, this vacation rental is an idyllic setting for a family reunion, intimate destination wedding or simply a relaxed holiday exploring the nearby towns, countryside and coast.The grounds at this historic luxury villa include an impressive L-shaped swimming pool, parasols and plenty of padded sun loungers. Serve refreshments from the outdoor bar, or try out local specialties in the comfort of one of the al-fresco dining areas. Inside, you’ll find an espresso machine for good mornings and a wine fridge and roulette table for even better evenings, as well as a television and Wi-Fi. For your comfort and convenience, your stay at the masseria includes the services of a butler, housekeeper and nighttime security guard.The strong lines of the villa’s stone walls and arched doorways set the tone for its palatial interiors, filled with one-of-a-kind antiques and paintings in the elegant traditional style. To set off classic pieces like the portraits and landscapes in gilded frames, however, the villa also has more modern furnishings, from a playful cherry-red sofa and armchairs to clean-lined dining chairs. The fully equipped minimalist kitchen is beautifully integrated into the original building, with super sleek cabinetry built into the textured stone walls.Five bedrooms, each with a double bed and en-suite bathroom, can accommodate up to eleven guests. Along with the villa’s staff, air conditioning in the bedrooms ensures your comfort on the warmest summer nights, and large windows and doors opening to a terrace and the surrounding olive groves let in both fresh air and plenty of Italian sunshine.Whether you’re visiting with family or for a romantic occasion such as a honeymoon or anniversary, Puglia has plenty to offer, from ancient Roman roads to a thriving local cuisine. The villa itself is just a short drive (or a ride on the property’s bikes) from the Coccaro Beach Club and the San Domenico Golf Course. The nearby town of Savelletri is the perfect spot to try fresh-caught seafood at an oceanfront café, and you’ll find more dining and shopping in the enchanting streets of Fasano and incredibly photogenic whitewashed buildings in Ostuni.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Nineteenth-century romance and modern luxury are in ample supply at the waterfront Villa Traversi. This historic vacation rental on the shores of Lake Como still has its traditional looks, but a recent makeover by its Italian fashion-designer owner has breathed new life into the interiors. More than 4,000 square feet of space, along with four bedrooms, offer room for a tranquil holiday with up to eight friends or family members.Look out over the lake and breathe in the sweet fragrance of an olea fragrans plant from outdoor living areas with a hydro-massage pool, plunge pool, plenty of loungers and a barbecue. There’s even a fish pond with a softly splashing waterfall to offer all your senses a short honeymoon from the everyday. Inside, a pool table, satellite TV, Wi-Fi and DVD player ensure evenings of fun.Past and present are perfectly balanced in the villa’s remodeled interiors. The open-concept living and dining room is anchored by a stately carved fireplace, while fold-away glass doors frame the views to the lake. The fully equipped kitchen is just as thoughtfully designed, with an inviting breakfast table in the center.Villa Traversi has two bedrooms with private en-suite bathrooms: one with a double bed and one with two twin beds. The other two bedrooms have two twin beds each and share access to a hall bathroom. For parties wanting different accommodations, the twin beds may be converted to one double bed.The villa’s setting in Laglio puts you within walking distance of a town center with shops, restaurants, services and more. Take the car on a day trip to historic attractions in Varenna or the Villa Monastero, or set off in a boat from the villa’s own dock to the town of Bellagio, just under an hour away on the lake.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Experience contemporary luxury in the setting of a charming, traditional beach town at Villa Alegria. Set on a cliff over the village of Salema, this breathtaking vacation rental boasts views over one of the prettiest landscapes in the Algarve and a location just steps from the beach. Share a sun-splashed holiday with up to eight friends and family at this four-bedroom haven—or a honeymoon-style escape with your beloved.Terraced gardens set into the hillside offer sea views at every level. At the rooftop, you’ll find an expansive outdoor living area with a pool, lounging and dining areas, and a barbecue. Inside the villa, high-tech amenities range from a satellite TV and DVD player to Wi-Fi.Nearly wall-to-wall windows on two sides bring the sea views into the open-plan living and dining room. Sleek furnishings add modern flair, while a color scheme of rich blues and crisp whites is a nod to the oceanfront location. The fully equipped kitchen is tucked behind the great room, but keeps the color scheme going with glossy white cabinetry and a cerulean backsplash.Each of the four bedrooms at Villa Alegria has a king bed and en-suite bathroom; one bedroom also has its own fireplace, and two of the bedrooms share a terrace. In each suite, you’ll find the same modern lines, cool tones and thoughtful details such as built-in storage.While the villa is a private seaside retreat, it’s only a 1-minute walk from the Salema beach, a stretch of golden sand frequented by visitors and locals alike. Pause to watch the fishermen unload the day’s catch, or while away an afternoon at restaurant on the water. For golf, tennis and a spa, drive to Santo Antonio Resort; for more shopping and dining options, drive into Lagos.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.
