listing.listing_description: As ornate and colorful as its prime Positano setting, Villa Dorata is among our most opulent villas on the Amalfi Coast. With frescoed ceilings, a private wine cellar, and a full-service spa, this luxurious Baroque-style home has to be seen to be believed.Surrounded by lemon and orange trees, Villa Dorata offers panoramic views of the sea and Positano, one of the Amalfi Coast’s most picturesque towns. The magnificent yet traditional exterior hides a wealth of amenities, including a private spa with a Turkish steam bath, tiled pool with waterfall and resistance swimming option, sauna, hot tub, massage room, and more.Inside the palazzo, the formal living room features gilt-framed paintings and a grand fireplace. Built-in bookshelves add a sense of history to the dining room, decorated with a crystal chandelier and antiques, and red drapes frame the villa’s sea views. With a stone fireplace and two pizza ovens, the Italian kitchen is every chef’s dream; for a memorable experience, take advantage of the complimentary Italian cooking class offered with each stay.On the first floor, the two lavish master bedrooms feature spacious sitting rooms, private en-suite bathrooms, and access to the sea view terrace. Upstairs, two junior queen suites offer views of the sea, gardens and Positano, with private access to the walled citrus garden. An additional spare bedroom with single bed and a private bathroom provides additional space for a teenage child or member of staff.Known for its exceptional restaurants and pebbled beaches, the town center of Positano is just a 15-minute walk away. Daily continental breakfasts and cook service are included with your stay at Villa Dorata, offering a truly relaxing escape. After all, what could be more appealing after a day exploring the Amalfi Coast’s attractions, than a restoring spa session and dinner on the sea-view terrace?Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

feature.p: The high Baroque architectural details evident throughout the villa are highlighted by a rich jewel tone color scheme, gilt-framed works of art, and romantic terraces. There are sumptuously soft sofas, crystal chandeliers, lavish draperies, inlaid ceilings, and exquisite alcoves that make a stay at villa Dorata a life-long memory. Outside, Eden-like gardens and surrounding groves make lounging and dining al fresco as privileged an experience as life within. Couple all this with a full staff just waiting to attend to your needs, including freshly squeezed juices from the lemons and oranges grown outside your bedroom windows, homemade marmalades and pastries, the finest wine cellar, and two traditional Italian pizza fornos!
feature.strong: What to do along the Amalfi Coast:
feature.p: In addition to lovely beaches, Positano offers an abundance of cafes, shops, art galleries and restaurants. A scenic drive along the coastal road (SS145) takes visitors to Praiano, Amalfi and the spellbinding up-hill town of Ravello, with its incomparable belvedere. Other excursion possibilities include a boat trip to the islands, a visit to vibrant Napoli or Salerno, or an exploration of Pompeii and Herculaneum—the fascinating ruins of ancient cities destroyed by the eruption of Mt. Vesuvius in the 1st century A.D.
Contact Luxury Retreats to arrange boat rentals and excursions.

listing.listing_description: Seek out simple luxury in Tuscany at Villa Ferranesi. This reconstructed farm was modeled on traditional houses in the Crete Senesi region, and sits amid quintessential rolling hills in the Asciano area outside Siena. Nine beautifully appointed bedrooms mean you can bring up to eighteen friends or family members on your Italian escape.Lay out under the Tuscan sun in loungers around the swimming pool, try out local specialties in the outdoor pizza oven and serve up refreshments at the al-fresco dining table. In the evenings, lay a fire in the wood-burning fireplace, watch TV or share photos of your holiday via Wi-Fi.While Villa Ferranesi looks to be all traditional stone walls from the outside, the interiors are open and bright, with soaring wood-beamed ceilings and graceful archways. A comfortable living room and inviting dining room are separated by the entryway and lit by high-set windows. The eat-in kitchen is fully equipped and even has a Nespresso machine.This expansive vacation rental has four bedrooms in its main house, two bedrooms in a guest house and three honeymoon-style private one-bedroom suites. All nine bedrooms have king beds and en-suite bathrooms, and many of the suites have their own living and dining areas as well. For larger parties, a double sofa bed is available in the two-bedroom house.From the villa’s location outside the town of Asciano, it’s easiest to explore the surrounding hills by car. Several nearby towns have, among other attractions, a historic abbey and sculpture garden, and the hill town of Montalcino is within easy reach. Visit the awe-inspiring pope’s palace in the UNESCO-designated town of Pienza, or taste the local wine in Montepulciano. For a memorable day trip, drive to the nearest city, Siena.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Podere Panico is a place with a story, a history, and genuine character. It’s one of the few vacation rentals that you will actually spend hours exploring, examining the fine details, and imagining the life that this once abandoned farmhouse has seen. For over four-hundred years Podere Panico has sat atop a hill on one of the main pilgrimage roads to Rome. It has played host to countless families, French soldiers during the second world war, and many others that only Panico will ever know. With accommodations for sixteen, and acres of picturesque outdoor space , it’s perfect for a wedding or other large scale event.Ancient wooden beams support Panico’s authentic clay roof. Romanesque brick archways connect living spaces within the interior. Designed, and eventually renovated, in the Medieval Tuscan architectural style, Panico is as close to the original build as possible. Generous living spaces merge seamlessly in its open concept layout. Vaulted ceilings and numerous openings keep the interior bright with natural light, and fresh hillside air flows freely throughout. Comfortable designer furniture and state of the art appliances add a touch of modern luxury to the rustic nature of this historical marvel.Other modern updates include Wi-Fi, air conditioning, an exercise room and sauna, and a media room. Some more traditional features inside are the beautiful stone fireplace and wood oven, great for preparing authentic Tuscan meals. Outside, you’ll love the rolling hills, olive groves, and privacy of Panico’s property. There’s a swimming pool and hot tub as well.All of Panico’s six bedrooms feature king sized beds and ensuite bathrooms. There are four bedrooms in the main house and two in the guest house. The master has its own fireplace and lounge area.Nearby in Siena, a town famous for its art, cuisine, museums, and medieval cityscapes, you’ll find plenty to explore. The Piazza del Campo in Siena’s city centre is a great place to start. Inside its perimeter you will find town hall Palazzo Public and its tower Torre del Mangia. Make sure to bring a camera.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: This fabulous luxury townhouse is located within steps of Earl's Court in the Kensington neighborhood of London. The renovated Victorian home with redbrick facade blends antique elegance, exceptional modern comforts, and beautiful contemporary artwork. Spacious interior living areas, a gourmet kitchen, and an ample alfresco terrace form an ideal haven for private enjoyments between excursions on the city. Three comfortable bedrooms accommodate families, business travelers, or groups of friends up to six in size.The apartment's central, open-concept living area offers ample room for serene downtime or festive gatherings, with large windows infusing the space with plentiful natural daylight. Enjoy cozy evenings in the lounge by the fire, watching your favorite TV programs or sharing a bottle of wine. Prepare delicious meals in the sleek, fully equipped kitchen, and gather around the beautiful table for six. Smooth hardwood floors and uncluttered white surfaces conjure a natural tranquility, accentuating the gallery-worthy artwork and subtle touches of exquisite décor.A lovely conservatory is located off the master bedroom, with skylight windows illuminating a quiet sitting area. This room leads through French doors to the private back terrace, featuring an open-air lounge area and table—perfect for meals and spirits under the summer sky.The master suite features a king bed, desk, TV, and deluxe ensuite bathroom with shower and freestanding tub. Each of the two guestrooms has a queen bed. One has access to a hallway bathroom, while the other enjoys an ensuite bathroom with shower. Heating throughout the home keeps you comfortable in the winter months.The vintage townhouse is within easy walking distance of Earl's Court and a plethora of fine restaurants, classic pubs, boutique stores, and Peter Jones. Explore other London neighborhoods via the Earl's Court Tube station, or drive minutes to nearby attractions including Harrods, Kensington Palace, and the V&A Museum.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Live out a historic Italian fantasy in the luxurious, newly renovated Villa Palazzo. From its romantic stucco exterior, medieval stone tower and 13th-century chapel and crypt to its traditionally furnished interiors and on-site staff, there’s plenty to inspire and pamper. Located less than an hour from Florence, Pisa and Siena, the six bedroom property makes the perfect base from which to explore Tuscany.The villa’s manicured lawn and garden commands a view of the countryside as far as the famed skyline of San Gimignano. Enjoy dinner fresh from the outdoor grill on the covered terrace, and descend a staircase to the pool, which has its own loggia with a shower and fridge. Explore the 13th century chapel dedicated to Saint Bartholomew or the Internet via the house’s Wi-Fi.True to its name, Villa Palazzo offers elegant, magazine worthy interiors. In the living room, historic touches like beamed ceilings, terracotta floors, carved fireplaces and damask chairs are paired with modern tuxedo sofas, all watched over by Renaissance style portraits. Sit down in the formal dining room, which has its own fireplace, or take your espresso in the more casual breakfast area adjoining the fully equipped modern white kitchen.There are five bedrooms in the main villa and one in the tower annex, each with its own character. In the main house, you’ll find two bedrooms with queen beds, one with an en-suite bathroom and one with a private bathroom, jetted tub and balcony. There are two bedrooms with two twin beds and private bathrooms. The fifth bedroom has two twin beds, combined to form a queen, as well as an en-suite bathroom with jetted tub. Climb the medieval tower to find a bedroom with a queen bed, en-suite bathroom, fireplace, sitting area and its own rooftop terrace.Villa Palazzo is about 2 miles outside the town of Castelfiorentino, which offers shopping, dining and a tennis court. Bring your clubs for a round at the Castelfalfi golf course, about 12 miles away. The sights of Florence, Siena and Pisa are each less than an hour away, and when it’s time to leave, it’s only 19 miles to the Florence airport and 28 miles to the Pisa airport.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Camparone is a majestic Tuscan villa in the countryside east of Siena. Nestled amid vineyards and olive groves on a vast estate, the villa consists of two antique buildings (a farmhouse and barn) dating from the fifteenth century. This authentic caselo's vintage character has been beautifully maintained in the stone facades, chestnut wood beams, terracotta tile, gorgeous brickwork, and enchanting gardens, while contemporary features include air conditioning, Wi-Fi, and high-end amenities for cooking and entertainment. Six bedrooms with ensuite bathrooms accommodate twelve guests in total comfort.The villa's expansive property forms an archetypal Tuscan scene, with centuries-old cypresses, wisteria-clad pergolas, and colorful flowers scenting the air. Ample lawns provide a lovely venue for special occasions or playful fun, while multiple terraces and verandas inspire alfresco delights. Refresh yourself in the swimming pool and bask in the Mediterranean sunlight on lovely lounge chairs. Kindle the barbeque in the afternoon and relish a meal in the shade of grapevines. Sip a local Chianti wine in the loggia while admiring the panoramic views.The main interior living area evokes the cozy elegance of a country cottage, with white wall and ceiling finishes lending a fresh feel to the classic ambiance. Open the glass doors to the patio in the summer months, and light a fire in the stone hearth on cool evenings. Sip aperitivi in the living room, or relax with a favorite book in the library. Prepare meals in the wonderful kitchen (featuring a pizza oven, chef-grade appliances, and enchanting rustic décor), and gather around the dining table for festive nighttime feasts.There are four bedrooms in the main house and two in the guest house. All enjoy ensuite bathrooms and air conditioning, and several of the rooms include private sitting areas. The guest house bedrooms share a small living area with kitchenette, as well as an outdoor veranda.This prime location is surrounded by charming villages, wineries, and architectural treasures, and is just a short drive from the Renaissance splendors of Siena. Florence, Arezzo, and the coastal Grosseto region offer lovely daytrip options. The villa is an excellent choice for destination wedding guests.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Villa Torre il Fico is a luxury villa located in Florence, Tuscany that provides a dream-like getaway experience. The interior of the villa has been tastefully renovated to create a bright atmosphere, admirably fusing the classic with the modern, while respecting excellent taste. Decorated by a famous Italian interior and art designer, pictures can only hint at the triumphant atmosphere and breathtaking view from every corner of the property.As you step inside Villa Torre il Fico, you’ll have the impression of living in a little chateau. The modern outdoor furnished areas feature precious handmade terracotta vases and a huge saltwater swimming pool with comfortable loungers. White seat cushions and white umbrellas provide the ideal setting for enjoying a moment in the shade. You can partake in alfresco dining on the several terraces around the house with your friends and family on a hot summer days sipping a nice glass of wine and savoring a meal of local specialties or just relaxing and having fun. Housekeeping is included with your reservation.The interiors reflect extremely high standards with Biedermaier furnishings and original, rare empire paintings, comfortable large white sofas and handmade linen curtains—all of which create a fresh atmosphere. The original and carefully decorated interior is graced with a gothic arch articulating the different living areas. The strictly sand stone floors, the walls painted in Venetian plaster pastel hues and the sophisticated antique furnishings complete the stunning decorative scheme of Villa Torre il Fico.A total of three bedrooms at Villa Torre il Fico can accommodate up to seven guests. Each bedroom, with its own spacious bathroom, is unique, different and finely decorated to satisfy discriminating tastes. You’ll spend every night in total tranquility at Villa Torre il Fico amid fine linens and accoutrements.For more active guests, an invigorating swim or a walk through the splendid Tuscan countryside can be the crowning grace of an idyllic vacation day. Visitors who appreciate beauty and history can reach the famous city of Florence, with its world class shopping for the fashionistas. During your stay at Villa Torre il Fico, you will be surrounded by the rich history of Italy and the bucolic charms of the countryside. The glory of Tuscany awaits!Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.

listing.listing_description: Close to Trecastagni, a village on the slopes of Mount Etna, and just 20 km from Catania, is where you’ll find this refined home, one of our most elegant villas in Sicily. This area of Italy is known for its beaches, mountains, volcano, historic attractions, and of course—its delectable food. You’ll find plenty to keep you amused here – in the warmer months enjoy the large in-ground swimming pool. Afterwards, lay out in the sun on a lounge chair nearby with a cool drink in hand and take in views of the property’s gardens. Kids and the young at heart will love a challenging round of ping pong or foosball. A twice-weekly tidying service and linen change is included, ensuring a comfortable stay. A welcome basket awaits you upon entering the villa for the first time. It’s a good introduction to the home’s inviting atmosphere, which includes high-end furnishings, rich fabrics and refined accents. This modern split-level home feels spacious and uncluttered and with a living room on each level, there’s plenty of room for everyone. The fully equipped masonry kitchen is outfitted with all the appliances you need, from a microwave to an electric oven and a dishwasher. Up to seven guests can be comfortably accommodated in this 3-bedroom villa in Sicily. Two rooms have double beds, while a third has two twins, and each includes an ensuite bathroom with a tub or shower. An additional single bed is located off of the hall leading to the master bedroom. Explore the surrounding area’s rich, historical attractions. At just over 2 km away, Viagrande’s shops, restaurants, and tennis court are conveniently close. Beach lovers can choose from rocky or sandy beaches, both just a short drive away.Copyright © Luxury Retreats. All rights reserved.
